course_title: Special Topics:African Studies: Writing Independence in Africa
class_notes:
(Same as ENG 345W 2)
(In this course we will explore some of the most powerful literary works produced by African writers since the start of decolonization in the 1950s. How do African writers imagine cultural, economic, and political independence? In what ways do their texts enact forms of independence and interdependence? To what extent does African literature itself depend on publishers and prizes based outside the continent? While our focus will be on English-language fiction, we will also examine essays and poetry in English, as well as film in other languages.)
course_description: May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
